resources.string: Adenocarcinoma is a type of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). It usually begins in the outer edges of the lungs and the lining of the bronchi (airway passages into the lungs). It is different from other types of lung carcinomas, which are usually more centrally located in the lungs. Adenocarcinoma grows more slowly than other types of lung cancer and forms smaller masses, but it can also metastasize in its early stages.\n

✔ Difficulty breathing
✔ Unexplained weight loss
✔ Hoarseness when speaking
✔ Chest pain
✔ Feeling tired or weak

Squamous cell carcinomas start in squamous cells, which are flat cells that line the inside of the airways in the lungs. They are often linked to a history of smoking and tend to be found in the central part of the lungs, near a main airway (bronchus).\n

✔ Shortness of breath and wheezing
✔ Hoarseness of the throat
✔ Swelling of the neck and face
✔ Bloody or rust colored sputum
✔ Pain and weakness in the shoulder, arm, or hand

\nLung cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the lungs. Your lungs are two spongy organs in your chest that take in oxygen when you inhale and release carbon dioxide when you exhale. Lung cancer is the leading cause of cancer deaths worldwide. People who smoke have the greatest risk of lung cancer, though lung cancer can also occur in people who have never smoked.\n
✔ Small cell lung cancer\n✔ Non-small cell lung cancer\n
Small cell lung cancer occurs almost exclusively in heavy smokers and is less common than non-small cell lung cancer.\n
Non-small cell lung cancer is an umbrella term for several types of lung cancers. Non-small cell lung cancers include squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma and large cell carcinoma.\n
Types of Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

✔ Adenocarcinoma
✔ Squamous Cell Carcinoma 
✔ Large Cell Carcinoma

Large cell carcinoma is a type of NSCLC. The National Cancer Institute state that large cell carcinoma is a type of cancer that can begin in several types of large cells. As the name suggests, these cancer cells appear larger than typical cancer cells when viewed under a microscope.

The aim of the application is to predict Lung cancer type by taking input as CT image of lungs.

The App uses VGG16 CNN Model to predict the Cancer type.

✔ Adenocarcinoma
✔ Squamous Cell Carcinoma 
✔ No Cancer Cell Detected
